metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Transitions
CSS Transitions
CSS transitions allows you to change property values smoothly, over a given duration.
content.html: CSS transitions allows you to change property values smoothly, over a given duration.

content.text: Mouse over the element below to see a CSS transition effect:
content.html: Mouse over the element below to see a CSS transition effect:

content.text: In this chapter you will learn about the following properties:
content.html: In this chapter you will learn about the following properties:

content.text: How to Use CSS Transitions?
To create a transition effect, you must specify two things:
content.html: To create a transition effect, you must specify two things:

content.text: Note: If the duration part is not specified, the transition will have no effect, because the default value is 0.
content.html: Note: If the duration part is not specified, the transition will have no effect, because the default value is 0.

content.text: The following example shows a 100px * 100px red <div> element. The <div> element has also specified a transition effect for the width property, with a duration of 2 seconds:
content.html: The following example shows a 100px * 100px red <div> element. The <div> element has also specified a transition effect for the width property, with a duration of 2 seconds:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
width: 100px;  height: 100px;  
background: red;  transition: width 2s;

syntax_highlighting.text:
width: 100px;  height: 100px;  
background: red;  transition: width 2s;

content.code_html:
div {
  width: 100px;
  height: 100px;
  background: red;
  transition: width 2s;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
width: 100px;  height: 100px;  
background: red;  transition: width 2s;

content.text: The transition effect will start when the specified CSS property (width) changes value.
content.html: The transition effect will start when the specified CSS property (width) changes value.

content.text: Now, let us specify a new value for the width property when a user mouses over the <div> element:
content.html: Now, let us specify a new value for the width property when a user mouses over the <div> element:

content.code_html:
div:hover {
  width: 300px;
}

content.text: Notice that when the cursor mouses out of the element, it will gradually change back to its original style.
content.html: Notice that when the cursor mouses out of the element, it will gradually change back to its original style.

content.text: Change Several Property Values
The following example adds a transition effect for both the width and height property, with a duration of 2 seconds for the width and 4 seconds for the height:
content.html: The following example adds a transition effect for both the width and height property, with a duration of 2 seconds for the width and 4 seconds for the height:

content.code_html:
div {
  transition: width 2s, height 4s;
}

content.text: Specify the Speed Curve of the Transition
The transition-timing-function property specifies the speed curve of the transition effect.
content.html: The transition-timing-function property specifies the speed curve of the transition effect.

content.text: The transition-timing-function property can have the following values:
content.html: The transition-timing-function property can have the following values:

content.text: The following example shows some of the different speed curves that can be used:
content.html: The following example shows some of the different speed curves that can be used:

content.code_html:
#div1 {transition-timing-function: linear;}
#div2 {transition-timing-function: ease;}
#div3 {transition-timing-function: ease-in;}
#div4 {transition-timing-function: ease-out;}
#div5 {transition-timing-function: ease-in-out;}

content.text: Delay the Transition Effect
The transition-delay property specifies a delay (in seconds) for the transition effect.
content.html: The transition-delay property specifies a delay (in seconds) for the transition effect.

content.text: The following example has a 1 second delay before starting:
content.html: The following example has a 1 second delay before starting:

content.code_html:
div {
  transition-delay: 1s;
}

content.text: Transition + Transformation
The following example adds a transition effect to the transformation:
content.html: The following example adds a transition effect to the transformation:

content.code_html:
div {
  transition: width 2s, height 2s, transform 2s;
}

content.text: More Transition Examples
The CSS transition properties can be specified one by one, like this:
content.html: The CSS transition properties can be specified one by one, like this:

content.code_html:
div {
  transition-property: width;
  transition-duration: 2s;
  transition-timing-function: linear;
  transition-delay: 1s;
}

content.text: or by using the shorthand property transition :
content.html: or by using the shorthand property transition:

content.code_html:
div {
  transition: width 2s linear 1s;
}

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page

content.text: CSS Transition Properties
The following table lists all the CSS transition properties:
content.html: The following table lists all the CSS transition properties:

content.code_html:
Property Description
transition A shorthand property for setting the four transition properties into a single property
transition-delay Specifies a delay (in seconds) for the transition effect
transition-duration Specifies how many seconds or milliseconds a transition effect takes to complete
transition-property Specifies the name of the CSS property the transition effect is for
transition-timing-function Specifies the speed curve of the transition effect
